snippet.textDisplay: Flu shots DO NOT prevent the spread of the flu. They are also not preventative of actually getting the flu. Herd immunity is a myth and a dangerous one. The only vaccine that is safe is the one you don’t get!

snippet.textDisplay: Great. Can you come to Italy and reassure our government, please?Panic rules, the whole country is like a containment bubble and we're starting to run out of toilet paper which ain't good, nor logic... there's no diarrhea involved. We can't get out of our town if not for work and emergencies, and if we do, we have to carry a self-certification. We're also out of sanitizers and surgical masks and people who really need them because they are sick, immunodepressed, etc. are forced to stay home. Schools, libraries, shops are closed. Hospitals and ERs are accessible only to covid patients or emergencies, any other kind of medical care that takes place in a hospital is mostly on hold.  And this is happening in the WHOLE country.

snippet.textDisplay:
Thank you sooo much for again clearing things up and providing people with not only reliable sources for information but also explaining the matter in an objective and calm way.

I am from germany and people around me are getting so anxious, that some broke into hospitals to steal face masks and sanitizer. What the hell?! This is wrong on sool many levels!😓

I'm also quite annoyed with the way, media is portraying our situation and am constantly trying to explain, that there is no reason to panick. Like seriously...even some friends at university are panicking and spreading stupid thesis about the virus and it's really frustrating to me, because they are smart and should know better, than trusting any weird articles on facebook without checking any sources!!!🤦🏻‍♀️
I really hope that things are going to calm down and I don't have to hear any stupid jokes about the corona virus (my heritage is chinese, but I am born in germany... so there's that...XD).

Please keep up your good work! Love your channel!❤
And to anyone who endured my nonstop rambling:
I hope you have a nice day, even though the world and everything around you seems shitty right now.😊
Don't let the negative or terrified way of other people affect you. Spread positivity and share this video and other information to ease their mindset and prevent more anxiety.
Thanks for reading my comment!❤😊

Like seriously...even some friends at university are panicking and spreading stupid thesis about the virus and it's really frustrating to me, because they are smart and should know better, than trusting any weird articles on facebook without checking any sources!!!🤦🏻‍♀️

snippet.textDisplay: Why are people freaking out over the coronavirus but no one freaks out about the flu? We face flu season every year and people don’t react this way. The flu is far deadlier and children/elderly/ill individuals are more vulnerable (just like with COVID-19). There is even a flu vaccine to help protect against the flu and only 45% of adults in the U.S got it last year. We don’t issue state emergencies for the flu.    So why are people reacting with such panic about this virus?
snippet.textOriginal: Why are people freaking out over the coronavirus but no one freaks out about the flu? We face flu season every year and people don’t react this way. The flu is far deadlier and children/elderly/ill individuals are more vulnerable (just like with COVID-19). There is even a flu vaccine to help protect against the flu and only 45% of adults in the U.S got it last year. We don’t issue state emergencies for the flu.    So why are people reacting with such panic about this virus?

snippet.textDisplay: Hello Dr. Mike, could you please talk about the social issues surrounding the viruses, especially the racism against Asian people. It's really sad to see that people took the coronavirus as a reason to discriminate Asians. As someone that is chinese, and was born and lived all my life in Canada, I see how other people are discriminating us. The fear in people eyes when I take the subway. Our Chinatown was vandalized. Temples were vandalized as well. This panic has caused so much pain in the Asian community and I hope you could bring some light to it. I love your videos about the covid-19 because they tell the REAL information that we need and it don't incite fear. Thank you for all your hard work!

snippet.textDisplay:
Intern: Sir we have a problem.
Media: What?
Intern: We have an INFORMED human being giving truthful common sense insight on the Coronavirus.
Media: Quit fucking with me, I thought we did away with that - Informed people, human beings, honesty AND common sense! We eradicated it!
Intern: For the most part, yes.

snippet.textDisplay:
The Norwegian Research Council has put out a $3 million dollar call for research projects into pretty much anything related to covid-19 (except vaccines, which were covered in a prior call). Most interesting to me is they specifically mentioned research into psychological factors like fear as interesting.


We've seen numbers go up here in Norway too, mostly because of travels to Italy. Because skiing. And we're seeing the media spread fear through click-baity headings and number vomit, but thankfully the National Health Service, the national government and municipal governments are, together with hospitals, being calm and assertive about the whole thing.


We're looking at a potential 25% of the population infected through the course of the entire pandemic, and our job is to try to prevent spreading of the disease, not primarily so people don't get it (in the case of elders and health care workers yes tho), but so not everyone gets infected at the same time.


If anyone's prepared it's us.
snippet.textOriginal:
The Norwegian Research Council has put out a $3 million dollar call for research projects into pretty much anything related to covid-19 (except vaccines, which were covered in a prior call). Most interesting to me is they specifically mentioned research into psychological factors like fear as interesting.


We've seen numbers go up here in Norway too, mostly because of travels to Italy. Because skiing. And we're seeing the media spread fear through click-baity headings and number vomit, but thankfully the National Health Service, the national government and municipal governments are, together with hospitals, being calm and assertive about the whole thing.


We're looking at a potential 25% of the population infected through the course of the entire pandemic, and our job is to try to prevent spreading of the disease, not primarily so people don't get it (in the case of elders and health care workers yes tho), but so not everyone gets infected at the same time.

snippet.textDisplay:
Doctor Mike, thought I'd throw this on your latest video to boost the chances of you seeing this, but God, do I wish you were my doctor, instead of the quack I have.

He finished his GP education 20+ years ago and refuses to update his methods of diagnosis. He's constantly late, and I don't mean he gets behind. I mean the clinic opened at 7am, and he's just rolling up, not ready to see any patients, at like 11am-2pm, when he had appointments for 7:30 am, he's short-tempered and snappy, and doesn't take the symptoms you've been experiencing seriously when you try to tell him. (Example, I had an ear ache, and I told him that my ear hurt like nothing I had ever experienced in my 12 years of life. I can't remember what his diagnosis was, but I remember it was something to do with my girl parts. I asked him to explain how my girl parts could make my ear hurt, and he told me that if I thought I knew better than him, I should become a doctor myself. Like, okay, but I was just confused and asked you to explain/clarify?? This was a couple years ago, and I'm now 18 going on 19.)

I had video evidence that I have been having seizures since I was two weeks old, and my former doctor had sent me for all of the tests to find what they were being caused by. Nothing showed up. Then my former doctor retired, so I moved to this doctor. Clearly I don't have seizures, right?

Please please please move to Canada and become my doctor, you're so nice-
snippet.textOriginal:
Doctor Mike, thought I'd throw this on your latest video to boost the chances of you seeing this, but God, do I wish you were my doctor, instead of the quack I have.  

He finished his GP education 20+ years ago and refuses to update his methods of diagnosis.  He's constantly late, and I don't mean he gets behind.  I mean the clinic opened at 7am, and he's just rolling up, not ready to see any patients, at like 11am-2pm, when he had appointments for 7:30 am, he's short-tempered and snappy, and doesn't take the symptoms you've been experiencing seriously when you try to tell him.  (Example, I had an ear ache, and I told him that my ear hurt like nothing I had ever experienced in my 12 years of life.  I can't remember what his diagnosis was, but I remember it was something to do with my girl parts.   I asked him to explain how my girl parts could make my ear hurt, and he told me that if I thought I knew better than him, I should become a doctor myself.  Like, okay, but I was just confused and asked you to explain/clarify??  This was a couple years ago, and I'm now 18 going on 19.)

I had video evidence that I have been having seizures since I was two weeks old, and my former doctor had sent me for all of the tests to find what they were being caused by.  Nothing showed up.  Then my former doctor retired, so I moved to this doctor.   Clearly I don't have seizures, right?

Please please please move to Canada and become my doctor, you're so nice-

snippet.textDisplay:
80% of cases are mild, yes.
But "mild", as defined by the Chinese, basically means you don't need to be put on a ventilator. You can still get pneumonia and be considered a "mild" case. That being said, autopsies show that the lungs develop a sticky "glue" like substance at the bottom, which appear to gradually seal the lungs shut from the bottom up. Even these alarmist articles have no grasp as to how dangerous this disease really is.
snippet.textOriginal:
80% of cases are mild, yes.
But "mild", as defined by the Chinese, basically means you don't need to be put on a ventilator. You can still get pneumonia and be considered a "mild" case. That being said, autopsies show that the lungs develop a sticky "glue" like substance at the bottom, which appear to gradually seal the lungs shut from the bottom up. Even these alarmist articles have no grasp as to how dangerous this disease really is.

snippet.textDisplay: Check how many people die every month from heart disease, car accidents, medical oops, and cancer and compare it to how many people are dying monthly from flu and virus. It will change everyone’s perspective. So far CV 19 looks about 2% more dangerous than run of the mill flu...max. I’ve had toxic mold toxicity and untreated Lyme until I could barely walk. I was given perspective.  Trace who gains money or power from the hysteria and you’ve got your answer.
